result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason R. Brown

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on November 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Final pre-trial on December 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Jury Trial on February 7, 2023 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): M.H.P. or residence.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk:  Amy. 
Called:  2:26 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Krista Cannon and Atty Natasha VanLieshout.  

Date and time set for initial appearance; VRCW.  
Atty Cannon states she did not receive copy of the complaint; ADA Mayo hands copy of complaint to Atty Cannon. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
PLEA:  Not guilty.  

BOND:  $500.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): M.H.P. or residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Prints and photograph. 

PTC:  11/07/22 at 9:45 a.m. 
FPT/TP:  12/16/22 at 10:15 a.m. 
JT:  2/07/22 at 9:00 a.m. 

Adj:  2:28 p.m.  

Branch 4.
Re: Copy of Summons and Criminal Complaint mailed to defendant
